data.text:
According to RightNow’s internal forecast, the revenue growth rate with the new strategy is 67%. In the pro forma balance sheet, I assume that line of credit, long-term debt, and shareholders’ equity stay the same. Other accounts grow at the same speed as revenue grows. From Exhibit 1, RightNow doesn’t need additional fund to support the strategy in 2004; instead, it could repay its debt. As a software company, RightNow has huge amount of deferred revenue, and this liability actually plays an important role as a financing tool. If the growth rate is not as high as expected or gross margin deteriorates, the size of discharged amount in 2004 will shrink.

The acquirer was willing to pay a multiple on RightNow’s revenue run rate, $50 million. …show more content…

The firm value is more sensitive to cost of asset than to long-term growth rate. If it is very likely that cost of asset will increase to more than 18%, Gianforte could consider the acquisition offer. Because the firm value will be lower than $155 million (3.1X), which may be the price that the acquirer will pay.

Although an acquisition would increase RightNow’s visibility, achieve market-leading solution breadth, and secure widespread distribution, being acquired also means giving up an opportunity to independently grow prosperously. According to the analysis above, RightNow’s value is around $207 million. As long as Forbe’s strategy keeps doing well and maintaining the expected growth rates, RightNow’s future potential is promising. If Rightnow reject the acquisition offer, it can either go IPO or keep focus on business growth. When a corporation is going IPO, it is confronted with huge administrative costs and management distraction from core and daily business. Besides, the market for tech IPOs was still depressed in 2003, and there were not many optimistic signs in the marketplace. However, its competitor SalesForce.com was going IPO soon. It is a good opportunity for RightNow to observe the market’s reaction to on-demand companies and thus determine the best IPO price. Moreover, IPO has the same advantage as acquisition---market
